properties.areaDesc: Flaming Gorge; East Sweetwater County; Rock Springs and Green River
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 6:35PM MST until February 6 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Another round of snow and wind will impact western and
northern Wyoming through Friday...

.A series of weather systems will be moving into northwest
Wyoming producing another round of significant snow. The snow
will begin first in northwest Wyoming before spreading across
western and northern Wyoming. Moderate to heavy snow will continue
through Friday, with the heaviest snowfall Thursday afternoon and
night.

In addition, strong winds along with blowing and drifting snow
will occur across southern and east central Wyoming through
Friday. The strongest winds will likely occur Friday.

* WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Winds gusts of 35 mph,
increasing up to 45 mph. Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph expected
early Thursday morning.

* WHERE...Rock Springs and Green River, Flaming Gorge and East
Sweetwater County, including Interstate 80.

* WHEN...Until noon MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility, with these conditions affecting travel along
Interstate 80. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY
